column4: hey folks... recently swapped out a bad laptop hard drive for a new one.  new one has been spinning for 10 hours (copying a bunch of files from my old box) and SMART data says it already has 4 bad sectors... is this normal?

hey folks... recently swapped out a bad laptop hard drive for a new one.  new one has been spinning for 10 hours (copying a bunch of files from my old box) and SMART data says it already has 4 bad sectors... is this normal?
4 bad sectors is so little you shouldn't worry
whats bad
drives develop bad sectors over time regardless of use
take a look at the smart data using the disk utility.  It gives some other numbers for perspective
all other smart data from disk utility sohws normal
what is the value / category that is not 'normal' ?
current pending sector count; 4
ohh, is it new?  Maybe this is bad.
I assumed we were talking about reallocated sector count
its a brand new drive

It's fine to have some reallocated sectors.  I sector is remapped.  Then it becomes reallocated.  Since your have some stuck pending that is not good.  The pending count should go back to 0 and reallocated should increase
when does this remapping happen?  reboot?
I believe it happens on the fly (instantly when a write fails).  I could be wrong though.
It might be delayed if you're doing a really big write / read like you said you are.
god damn it; its been a day and a half just to get this drive swapped data baked up etc
It shouldn't take a day.5 just to copy a hdd
well it takes longer if your old drive had a bunch of errors and kept crapping out; along with slow read speed
ahh, yes.  Just copy user data :)
